header.title: Shortest Path in a Weighted Graph

description.text: Given a weighted undirected graph, determine the shortest path between two specified vertices using Dijkstra's algorithm. The graph is described by the number of vertices, the number of edges, and the edges themselves which include two vertices and a weight. If no path exists between the specified vertices, output 'NO'.
description.input_format: The first line contains an integer t - the number of test cases. For each test case, the first line contains two integers V and K - the number of vertices and the number of edges. The next K lines each contain three integers ai, bi, ci representing an edge between vertices ai and bi with weight ci. The last line of each test case contains two integers A and B - the source and destination vertices.
description.output_format: For each test case, output the length of the shortest path from vertex A to vertex B. If no such path exists, output 'NO'.
